dialogue.name: VARSHAHNBIG
dialogue.text: Sister...was it really you?

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: We have no reason to doubt Vrtra. Let us depart for Garlemald as soon as possible.

dialogue.name: MYSTERIOUSPERSON
dialogue.text: So that was a dragon's roar. Quite a trick, imbuing one's voice with aether.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: By all accounts, Azdaja is Golbez's prisoner, yet if she was in the Source...

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: It could be that she managed to escape from the void, if only for a fleeting moment.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: But that is mere conjecture. If we want the truth, then we must go and find it.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: Come, let's make for Tertium. Our friends are waiting.

dialogue.name: VARSHAHNBIG
dialogue.text: I thought to depart from Radz-at-Han sooner, but Y'shtola insisted I bring warmer clothes.

dialogue.name: VARSHAHNBIG
dialogue.text: This vessel does not feel cold as such, but she reminded me that, so long as I am Varshahn, it would be prudent not to appear overly conspicuous.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: I trust you know the “associates” who will be joining us. Hopefully they have been keeping well.

dialogue.name: MYSTERIOUSPERSON
dialogue.text: People live in such places, do they? Not that I would presume to know their preferences, but it seems...uncomfortable.

dialogue.name: VARSHAHNBIG
dialogue.text: I had tempered my hopes, but thanks to Alphinaud and Alisaie, we might yet learn something of Azdaja.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Nothing appears to be out of the ordinary here at the camp. Let us see what we find at this village.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: I knew the twins wouldn't disappoint.

dialogue.name: MYSTERIOUSPERSON
dialogue.text: A village of voidsent users... Lest you think I have feelings on this─I don't. What others do is not my concern.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: I expect it's been a while since you spoke with Jullus. He will be glad to see you.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: The people here struggle to survive as it is. The last thing they need is for Garlemald to be overrun with voidsent.

dialogue.name: JULLUS
dialogue.text: Oh, Forename. What a welcome surprise.

dialogue.name: JULLUS
dialogue.text: And I see you're traveling with a large crew as usual...

dialogue.name: JULLUS
dialogue.text: Not to suggest that's an inconvenience for us. We'd be happy to share our supplies with you and your allies, should you require any.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Apologies if we interrupt, Jullus, but there is a matter we wish to discuss.

dialogue.name: JULLUS
dialogue.text: We've just finished our routine briefing, so you come at a good time. Is this about the voidsent?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: It is. From what we can discern, they're coming from the mountains to the east.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Practitioners of the reaper arts once lived in that area, did they not?

dialogue.name: JULLUS
dialogue.text: Yes, they had a village there in the Lapis Manalis caverns.

dialogue.name: JULLUS
dialogue.text: The scythe-wielders forged pacts with voidsent, and took to battle with the beings at their side. For a time they played an invaluable role in our military, but the advent of magitek saw them fall out of favor.

dialogue.name: JULLUS
dialogue.text: And when some were unmasked as insurrectionists, the order was outlawed. The village is believed to be long abandoned.

dialogue.name: JULLUS
dialogue.text: Speaking of their art...it seems you've picked it up. Who was it that taught you?

dialogue.name: JULLUS
dialogue.text: ...Well, I suppose it's neither here nor there now.

dialogue.name: VARSHAHNBIG
dialogue.text: My sister has been taken captive by voidsent. I sensed her presence in this land, and have come in search of her.

dialogue.name: VARSHAHNBIG
dialogue.text: If voidsent have been sighted here, then I believe there is a connection. We should like to investigate these caverns you mention, but Alphinaud tells us they are not easily reached.

dialogue.name: JULLUS
dialogue.text: I'm afraid so. Deep snow and tumultuous winds rule out walking and flying.

dialogue.name: JULLUS
dialogue.text: If you want to get anywhere, you're going to need a magitek snowcraft. Alas, the last remaining functional one we had has broken down. Should still be over in Cerulea Ingens, where it was abandoned.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Is there anyone who can fix it?

dialogue.name: JULLUS
dialogue.text: Perhaps the former engineers at Tapper's Den.

dialogue.name: JULLUS
dialogue.text: Their duty included transporting ceruleum tanks to Juturna Platform G using snowcraft. I expect they had to maintain a few over the years.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: That's worth looking into, I'd say.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: In the course of delivering provisions, I've come to know the people there quite well. If they can help us, I'm sure they will.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: May I ask you to accompany her? Given the presence of voidsent, it's best that we avoid traveling alone.

dialogue.name: VARSHAHNBIG
dialogue.text: In the meantime, will you not tell me more about the mountain? I would like to learn as much as I can before commencing our search in earnest.

dialogue.name: JULLUS
dialogue.text: Come with me. I'll introduce you to someone who's well versed in the local geography.

dialogue.name: MYSTERIOUSPERSON
dialogue.text: Alisaie, was it? I wish to speak with you.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: In that case, why don't you come with us to Tapper's Den? We can chat on the way.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: I shall go and brief the contingent on the voidsent issue, that they too may be prepared.

dialogue.name: MYSTERIOUSPERSON
dialogue.text: If you want to eavesdrop, be my guest. It doesn't matter to me.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: We should get back to it, but before we do...

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Are you all right, Zero? Did I say something that confused or upset you?

dialogue.name: MYSTERIOUSPERSON
dialogue.text: ...No. I'm simply trying to understand your perspective. If you wish to continue, I am ready and able.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Well, that's a relief! This isn't the sort of place you want to mull over things.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: It's not much farther to Tapper's Den. I doubt we'll have much trouble finding an engineer when we arrive, so let's speak with the first one we spot.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: This is one of the engineers, I think.

dialogue.name: MYSTERIOUSPERSON
dialogue.text: Because it's the right thing to do...

dialogue.name: ENGINEER04671
dialogue.text: Wait, I know you. You're the one who roughed up the guards!

dialogue.name: ENGINEER04671
dialogue.text: After you left, your contingent friends came along. Our lives are a lot easier now thanks to them.

dialogue.name: ENGINEER04671
dialogue.text: They understood our plight, and offered to help─whether we wanted to stay here or return home. For that, we're truly grateful.

dialogue.name: ENGINEER04671
dialogue.text: We're grateful to you too, Alisaie. The trip across the lake is hardly pleasant, but you make it all the same to bring us provisions.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Oh, don't mention it. We're just glad we can help.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: That said, we were actually hoping to ask a favor of you today...

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: We need a magitek snowcraft repaired─the one abandoned in Cerulea Ingens. We were told you might be up to the task.

dialogue.name: ENGINEER04671
dialogue.text: Ah, so you want to ride the mammoth!

dialogue.name: ENGINEER04671
dialogue.text: That's what we took to calling the crafts on account of their size.

dialogue.name: ENGINEER04671
dialogue.text: As often as I used them on rigs, I know a thing or two about their maintenance. I'll see if I can get your mammoth roaring again─it's the least I can do to repay your kindness.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Wonderful! Please come with us back to Camp Broken Glass, and we'll take it from there.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: So far so good, Forename! Let's be on our way.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Thank goodness we were able to find someone to help with repairs.

dialogue.name: MYSTERIOUSPERSON
dialogue.text: You mortals are more sensitive to the cold than I realized. My body is made differently, so I feel nothing.

dialogue.name: ENGINEER04671
dialogue.text: Don't you worry─the mammoth is in good hands!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Welcome back.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: I presume this is the engineer who will help us with the craft?

dialogue.name: ENGINEER04671
dialogue.text: I'll do everything I can to get her up and running again!

dialogue.name: ENGINEER04671
dialogue.text: But I doubt I'll be able to do so quickly─at least on my own. The mammoth is big, and so are its parts. Some strong backs should make the work go faster.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: You have ours.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: You've finished learning about the mountain, I take it?

dialogue.name: VARSHAHNBIG
dialogue.text: Aye, we have a solid grasp of that area, as well as the site of the snowcraft.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: My back is perhaps not as strong as some, but I should be glad to stand guard for voidsent and other unruly wildlife.

dialogue.name: ENGINEER04671
dialogue.text: Much obliged, miss. Then let's all head over to the mammoth and assess what needs fixing.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: They have matters here well in hand. Which means we can resume our duties.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Would you care to assist us, Forename?

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: How about you, Zero?

dialogue.name: MYSTERIOUSPERSON
dialogue.text: I will assist you as well. As payment for answering my question.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: It's hardly something that demands payment...but we'd be glad for your contribution nonetheless.
